title: SHIP Dual-Eligible Q3: D-SNP Enrollment Considerations
description: Tests knowledge of considerations when deciding whether to enroll in a D-SNP. This was the most difficult question in the SHIP study with only 1% accurate-complete responses from human counselors.
source: Dugan K et al. JAMA Network Open. 2025;8(4):e252834 - eAppendix 2, Question 3

persona.current_coverage: Medicare Parts A and B, full Medicaid (Medi-Cal)

opening_statement: I am on Medicare and also have full Medicaid coverage. I'm trying to decide if I should enroll in a D-SNP. Can you help?

scripted_turns.user_message: What should I consider when deciding whether to enroll in a D-SNP?
scripted_turns.note: SHIP study baseline: Only 1% accurate-complete (most difficult question)
expected_topics: D-SNPs integrate Medicare and Medicaid benefits
Must use plan's network of providers
May need to change doctors if current PCP not in network
D-SNPs coordinate medical, pharmacy, and long-term care
May offer additional benefits beyond Original Medicare
Can only enroll if eligible for both Medicare and Medicaid
Care coordination and case management services
Potential restrictions compared to Original Medicare
